Notes: SG&A, R&D, and other non-direct costs.
Profit from core business operations (Gross Profit - Op Expenses).
Money owed to the company by customers.
Assets expected to be sold/used within a year.
Premium paid over fair value during acquisitions.
Sum of all current and non-current assets.
Money owed by the company to suppliers.
Sum of all debts and obligations.
Funds raised in exchange for stock.
Cumulative net earnings not distributed as dividends.
Non-cash expense added back to Net Income.
Cash effect of changes in AR, Inventory, AP.
Net cash generated from core business.
Cash spent on physical assets (usually negative).
Cash from debt/equity issuance or repayment.
Sum of Operating, Investing, and Financing flows.
Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depr, Amort.
